ar.com.hjg.pngj

Class ImageInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • ar.com.hjg.pngj.ImageInfo

  • public class ImageInfo
extends Object
    Simple immutable wrapper for basic image info.

    Some parameters are redundant, but the constructor receives an 'orthogonal' subset.

    ref: http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11IHDR

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean alpha
      Flag: true if has alpha channel (RGBA/GA)
      int bitDepth
      Bits per sample (per channel) in the buffer (1-2-4-8-16).
      int bitspPixel
      Bits used for each pixel in the buffer: channel * bitDepth
      int bytesPerRow
      ceil(bitspp*cols/8) - does not include filter
      int bytesPixel
      rounded up value: this is only used internally for filter
      int channels
      Number of channels, as used internally: 3 for RGB, 4 for RGBA, 2 for GA (gray with alpha), 1 for grayscale or indexed.
      int cols
      Cols= Image width, in pixels.
      boolean greyscale
      Flag: true if is grayscale (G/GA)
      boolean indexed
      Flag: true if image is indexed, i.e., it has a palette
      static int MAX_COLS_ROW
      Absolute allowed maximum value for rows and cols (2^24 ~16 million).
      boolean packed
      Flag: true if image internally uses less than one byte per sample (bit depth 1-2-4)
      int rows
      Rows= Image height, in pixels
      int samplesPerRow
      Equals cols * channels
      int samplesPerRowPacked
      Amount of "packed samples" : when several samples are stored in a single byte (bitdepth 1,2 4) they are counted as one "packed sample".

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_COLS_ROW

        public static final int MAX_COLS_ROW
        Absolute allowed maximum value for rows and cols (2^24 ~16 million). (bytesPerRow must fit in a 32bit integer, though total amount of pixels not necessarily).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • cols

        public final int cols
        Cols= Image width, in pixels.

      • rows

        public final int rows
        Rows= Image height, in pixels

      • bitDepth

        public final int bitDepth
        Bits per sample (per channel) in the buffer (1-2-4-8-16). This is 8-16 for RGB/ARGB images, 1-2-4-8 for grayscale. For indexed images, number of bits per palette index (1-2-4-8)

      • channels

        public final int channels
        Number of channels, as used internally: 3 for RGB, 4 for RGBA, 2 for GA (gray with alpha), 1 for grayscale or indexed.

      • alpha

        public final boolean alpha
        Flag: true if has alpha channel (RGBA/GA)

      • greyscale

        public final boolean greyscale
        Flag: true if is grayscale (G/GA)

      • indexed

        public final boolean indexed
        Flag: true if image is indexed, i.e., it has a palette

      • packed

        public final boolean packed
        Flag: true if image internally uses less than one byte per sample (bit depth 1-2-4)

      • bitspPixel

        public final int bitspPixel
        Bits used for each pixel in the buffer: channel * bitDepth

      • bytesPixel

        public final int bytesPixel
        rounded up value: this is only used internally for filter

      • bytesPerRow

        public final int bytesPerRow
        ceil(bitspp*cols/8) - does not include filter

      • samplesPerRow

        public final int samplesPerRow
        Equals cols * channels

      • samplesPerRowPacked

        public final int samplesPerRowPacked
        Amount of "packed samples" : when several samples are stored in a single byte (bitdepth 1,2 4) they are counted as one "packed sample". This is less that samplesPerRow only when bitdepth is 1-2-4 (flag packed = true)

        This equals the number of elements in the scanline array if working with packedMode=true

        For internal use, client code should rarely access this.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageInfo

        public ImageInfo(int cols,
         int rows,
         int bitdepth,
         boolean alpha)
        Short constructor: assumes truecolor (RGB/RGBA)

      • ImageInfo

        public ImageInfo(int cols,
         int rows,
         int bitdepth,
         boolean alpha,
         boolean grayscale,
         boolean indexed)
        Full constructor
        Parameters:
        cols - Width in pixels
        rows - Height in pixels
        bitdepth - Bits per sample, in the buffer : 8-16 for RGB true color and greyscale
        alpha - Flag: has an alpha channel (RGBA or GA)
        grayscale - Flag: is gray scale (any bitdepth, with or without alpha)
        indexed - Flag: has palette

    • Method Detail

      • withSize

        public ImageInfo withSize(int cols,
                 int rows)
        returns a copy with different size
        Parameters:
        cols - if non-positive, the original is used
        rows - if non-positive, the original is used
        Returns:
        a new copy with the specified size and same properties

      • getTotalPixels

        public long getTotalPixels()

      • getTotalRawBytes

        public long getTotalRawBytes()
        Total uncompressed bytes in IDAT, including filter byte. This is not valid for interlaced.
